<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 186, 171, 201]]<|/det|>
# PHYSICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 206, 332, 222]]<|/det|>
Paper 1 Multiple Choice (Core)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[782, 185, 907, 243]]<|/det|>
0625/13 May/June 2019 45 minutes  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 247, 588, 291]]<|/det|>
Additional Materials: Multiple Choice Answer Sheet Soft clean eraser Soft pencil (type B or HB recommended)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 312, 388, 329]]<|/det|>
## READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 342, 237, 357]]<|/det|>
Write in soft pencil.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 357, 504, 372]]<|/det|>
Do not use staples, paper clips, glue or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 372, 892, 402]]<|/det|>
Write your name, centre number and candidate number on the Answer Sheet in the spaces provided unless this has been done for you.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 400, 383, 416]]<|/det|>
DO NOT WRITE IN ANY BARCODES.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 429, 892, 460]]<|/det|>
There are forty questions on this paper. Answer all questions. For each question there are four possible answers A, B, C and D.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 459, 890, 475]]<|/det|>
Choose the one you consider correct and record your choice in soft pencil on the separate Answer Sheet.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 488, 556, 504]]<|/det|>
Read the instructions on the Answer Sheet very carefully.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 517, 765, 533]]<|/det|>
Each correct answer will score one mark. A mark will not be deducted for a wrong answer.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 533, 467, 548]]<|/det|>
Any rough working should be done in this booklet.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 548, 359, 563]]<|/det|>
Electronic calculators may be used.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 562, 630, 578]]<|/det|>
Take the weight of \(1.0\mathrm{kg}\) to be \(10\mathrm{N}\) (acceleration of free fall \(= 10\mathrm{m / s}^2\) ).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 96, 88]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 599, 89]]<|/det|> The diagram shows a measuring cylinder containing liquid. <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[384, 103, 603, 336]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 345, 601, 364]]<|/det|> What is the reading for the volume of liquid in the cylinder? <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 373, 133, 392]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 373, 228, 392]]<|/det|> 13.0 cm続 <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[280, 373, 300, 392]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[313, 373, 393, 392]]<|/det|> 13.5 cm続 <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[448, 373, 470, 392]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[473, 373, 561, 392]]<|/det|> 16.0 cm続 <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[615, 373, 636, 392]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[640, 373, 730, 392]]<|/det|> 17.0 cm続 <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 418, 97, 437]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 418, 539, 437]]<|/det|> The diagram shows the speed-time graph for a car. <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[324, 445, 668, 584]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 597, 677, 616]]<|/det|> Which row describes the motion of the car at point X and at point Y? <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 625, 744, 757]]<|/det|>
point Xpoint Y
Aat restmoving with constant speed

speed is
greatest between		time is
shortest between

BJ and KL and M
CL and MJ and K
DL and ML and M

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 72, 897, 91]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 287, 767, 305]]<|/det|>
The resistive forces decrease to make the acceleration of the car negative.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 314, 134, 332]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 314, 732, 332]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 341, 133, 359]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 341, 760, 358]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 367, 725, 384]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 592, 339, 610]]<|/det|>
A machine is very efficient.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 622, 304, 640]]<|/det|>
What does this mean?

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 651, 134, 670]]<|/det|>
<label>A</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 650, 457, 670]]<|/det|>
It produces a large amount of power.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 677, 134, 694]]<|/det|>
<label>B</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 677, 354, 694]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 702, 134, 720]]<|/det|>
<label>C</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 702, 373, 720]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 728, 134, 746]]<|/det|>
<label>D</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 728, 324, 746]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 774, 104, 791]]<|/det|>
<label>11</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 774, 368, 791]]<|/det|>
A body is lifted against gravity.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 803, 541, 821]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 831, 133, 850]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 831, 579, 850]]<|/det|>
work done = change in distance moved by the body

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 858, 133, 876]]<|/det|>
<label>B</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 858, 500, 876]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 884, 133, 902]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 884, 490, 902]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 910, 133, 928]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 910, 495, 928]]<|/det|>

<label>13</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 526, 920, 560]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows a stone suspended on a string under the surface of a liquid. The stone experiences a pressure caused by the liquid.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[354, 567, 638, 714]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 755, 133, 774]]<|/det|>
<label>A</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 755, 487, 774]]<|/det|>
decreasing the surface area of the stone

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 782, 133, 801]]<|/det|>
<label>B</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 782, 421, 801]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 809, 133, 828]]<|/det|>
<label>C</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 809, 485, 828]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 836, 133, 853]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 836, 432, 853]]<|/det|>

<label>14</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 348, 88]]<|/det|>
Which statement is correct?

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 100, 134, 117]]<|/det|>
<label>A</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 100, 288, 117]]<|/det|>
A solid can flow.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 126, 134, 144]]<|/det|>
<label>B</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 126, 435, 144]]<|/det|>
A solid can be compressed easily.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 153, 134, 170]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 152, 366, 170]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 178, 134, 196]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 178, 479, 196]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 222, 107, 241]]<|/det|>
<label>15</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 222, 603, 241]]<|/det|>
On a hot summer day, the level of the water in a pond falls.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 253, 376, 271]]<|/det|>
Which statement explains this?

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 281, 134, 299]]<|/det|>
<label>A</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 281, 808, 299]]<|/det|>
The least energetic water molecules escape from the surface and do not return.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 308, 134, 326]]<|/det|>
<label>B</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 307, 791, 325]]<|/det|>
The least energetic water molecules escape from the surface and then return.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 335, 134, 352]]<|/det|>
<label>C</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 333, 808, 351]]<|/det|>
The most energetic water molecules escape from the surface and do not return.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 359, 134, 378]]<|/det|>
<label>D</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 359, 791, 377]]<|/det|>
The most energetic water molecules escape from the surface and then return.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 404, 104, 422]]<|/det|>
<label>16</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 403, 803, 422]]<|/det|>
Here are three statements about a liquid-in-glass thermometer with a Celsius scale.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 434, 191, 453]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[218, 434, 789, 453]]<|/det|>
The lower fixed point is the temperature at which pure water freezes.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 460, 767, 479]]<|/det|>
The upper fixed point is the temperature at which pure water boils.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 487, 920, 521]]<|/det|>
A scale is made by dividing the distance between the fixed points into equal divisions.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 530, 371, 548]]<|/det|>
Which statements are correct?

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 560, 133, 578]]<|/det|>
<label>A</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 560, 175, 578]]<|/det|>
1

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[180, 560, 740, 578]]<|/det|>
and 2 only B 2 and 3 only C 1 and 3 only D 1, 2 and 3

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 72, 106, 88]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 920, 104]]<|/det|> A night storage heater contains a large block of material that is heated electrically during the night. During the day the block cools down, releasing thermal energy into the room. <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[413, 114, 581, 262]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 274, 920, 308]]<|/det|> Which thermal capacity and which night-time temperature increase will cause the most energy to be stored by the block? <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 319, 562, 465]]<|/det|>
thermal capacity of blocknight-time temperature increase
Alargelarge
Blargesmall
Csmalllarge
Dsmallsmall
<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 492, 106, 509]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 492, 920, 526]]<|/det|> A student investigates the melting point of a pure substance. She heats the substance slowly and takes readings of its temperature as the substance starts to melt and when it finishes melting. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 536, 348, 554]]<|/det|> Which statement is correct? <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 566, 134, 584]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[146, 566, 645, 584]]<|/det|> The temperature decreases slightly as the substance melts. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 593, 134, 611]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[146, 593, 576, 611]]<|/det|> The temperature fluctuates as the substance melts. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 619, 134, 637]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[146, 619, 576, 637]]<|/det|> The temperature increases as the substance melts. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 645, 134, 663]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[146, 645, 621, 663]]<|/det|> The temperature stays the same as the substance melts. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 689, 106, 707]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 689, 658, 707]]<|/det|> A person holds an empty glass beaker and pours hot water into it. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 718, 660, 736]]<|/det|> Why does it take a few seconds before his hand starts to feel hot? <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 747, 134, 765]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 747, 432, 765]]<|/det|> Glass is a poor conductor of heat. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 774, 134, 792]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 774, 432, 792]]<|/det|> Water is a poor conductor of heat. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 800, 131, 819]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 800, 534, 817]]<|/det|> Glass is a better conductor of heat than water. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 826, 133, 844]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 826, 534, 844]]<|/det|> Water is a better conductor of heat than glass.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 107, 88]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 494, 88]]<|/det|> Which statement about ultrasound is correct? <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 100, 134, 117]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 100, 764, 117]]<|/det|> It has a higher frequency than audible sound, and it is a longitudinal wave. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 126, 133, 144]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 126, 755, 144]]<|/det|> It has a higher frequency than audible sound, and it is a transverse wave. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 153, 131, 170]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 152, 755, 170]]<|/det|> It has a lower frequency than audible sound, and it is a longitudinal wave. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 179, 133, 196]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 179, 747, 196]]<|/det|> It has a lower frequency than audible sound, and it is a transverse wave. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 223, 106, 241]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 223, 730, 241]]<|/det|> A metal bar is placed inside a current-carrying coil, as shown in diagram 1. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 253, 813, 271]]<|/det|> There is a small current in the coil. The bar holds a few nails, as shown in diagram 2. <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[220, 279, 776, 375]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 390, 559, 408]]<|/det|> When there is no current in the coil, the nails drop off. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 421, 298, 438]]<|/det|> Which row is correct? <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 450, 626, 597]]<|/det|>
metal from which the bar is madeeffect of a larger current in the coil

Bsoft ironthe bar holds more nails

Dsteelthe bar holds more nails

charge on stripsforce between strips

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 288, 107, 306]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 288, 897, 306]]<|/det|> The diagram shows a circuit including a lamp, an electric bell and three switches \(\mathsf{S}_1\) , \(\mathsf{S}_2\) and \(\mathsf{S}_3\) . <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 320, 384, 338]]<|/det|> The lamp and bell are not faulty. <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[393, 348, 603, 520]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 535, 445, 552]]<|/det|> The bell is ringing but the lamp is not lit. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 566, 348, 583]]<|/det|> Which switches are closed? <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 593, 131, 611]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 593, 213, 611]]<|/det|> S1 only <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 620, 131, 637]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 620, 275, 637]]<|/det|> S1 and S2 only <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 647, 131, 664]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 647, 275, 664]]<|/det|> S1 and S3 only <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 673, 131, 691]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 673, 265, 691]]<|/det|> S1, S2 and S3

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 106, 90]]<|/det|>
<label>33</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 853, 91]]<|/det|>
A student is designing a lighting circuit for a dolls' house. He sets up two different circuits.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 101, 675, 120]]<|/det|>
Each circuit contains a \(12\mathrm{V}\) power supply and three identical lamps.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 131, 922, 166]]<|/det|>
Each lamp is designed to operate at normal brightness when connected individually to a \(12\mathrm{V}\) supply.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[173, 173, 828, 352]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 364, 348, 382]]<|/det|>
Which statement is correct?

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 393, 134, 411]]<|/det|>
<label>A</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 393, 593, 411]]<|/det|>
In circuit 1, each of the lamps is at normal brightness.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 420, 134, 438]]<|/det|>
<label>B</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 420, 601, 438]]<|/det|>
In circuit 1, if one lamp fails, the other lamps remain lit.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 446, 134, 465]]<|/det|>
<label>C</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 446, 601, 464]]<|/det|>
In circuit 2, if one lamp fails, the other lamps remain lit.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 472, 133, 490]]<|/det|>
<label>D</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 472, 717, 490]]<|/det|>
In circuit 2, the current from the power supply is less than in circuit 1.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 516, 106, 534]]<|/det|>
<label>34</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 515, 920, 548]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 560, 430, 578]]<|/det|>
Which circuit would be most suitable?

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 586, 841, 933]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[824, 942, 920, 959]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 106, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>35</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 576, 91]]<|/det|>
A simple wiring diagram for an electric cooker is shown.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[287, 97, 707, 324]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 333, 688, 353]]<|/det|>
Why is there a wire connecting the metal case of the cooker to earth?

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 362, 134, 380]]<|/det|>
<label>A</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 363, 475, 381]]<|/det|>
It improves the efficiency of the cooker.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 388, 134, 408]]<|/det|>
<label>B</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 388, 777, 408]]<|/det|>
It prevents the metal case from becoming too hot when the cooker is left on.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 415, 134, 433]]<|/det|>
<label>C</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 415, 784, 433]]<|/det|>
It reduces the risk of an electric shock if the live wire touches the metal case.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 441, 134, 460]]<|/det|>
<label>D</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 441, 541, 460]]<|/det|>
The electric cooker will not switch on without it.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 106, 88]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 675, 89]]<|/det|> In an experiment, a wire is held above a compass needle as shown. <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[295, 100, 700, 225]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 235, 792, 252]]<|/det|> An electric current is switched on in the wire and the compass needle is deflected. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 266, 920, 299]]<|/det|> Which row explains why this happens and then describes what happens when the current is reversed? <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 311, 690, 516]]<|/det|>
why this happenswhat happens when the current is reversed
Athere is a magnetic field inside the wirethe compass needle deflects in the opposite direction
Bthere is a magnetic field inside the wirethere is no effect on the compass needle
Cthere is a magnetic field around the wirethe compass needle deflects in the opposite direction
Dthere is a magnetic field around the wirethere is no effect on the compass needle
<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 545, 106, 562]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 545, 672, 562]]<|/det|> Which device relies upon the magnetic effect of an electric current? <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 574, 139, 592]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 574, 193, 592]]<|/det|> fuse <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 600, 143, 618]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 600, 196, 618]]<|/det|> relay <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 628, 139, 644]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 628, 240, 644]]<|/det|> thermistor <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 653, 139, 670]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 653, 288, 670]]<|/det|> variable resistor <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 696, 106, 714]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 696, 601, 714]]<|/det|> Which statement about the structure of an atom is correct? <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 725, 131, 743]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 725, 512, 743]]<|/det|> It contains positively charged particles only. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 752, 131, 769]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 752, 520, 769]]<|/det|> It contains negatively charged particles only. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 778, 131, 796]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 778, 416, 796]]<|/det|> It contains no charged particles. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 804, 133, 822]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 804, 744, 822]]<|/det|> It contains positively charged particles and negatively charged particles.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 104, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>39</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 490, 90]]<|/det|>
Which statement about \(\gamma\) - radiation is correct?

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 100, 133, 118]]<|/det|>
<label>A</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 100, 497, 118]]<|/det|>
It consists of very small charged particles.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 127, 133, 144]]<|/det|>
<label>B</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 127, 480, 144]]<|/det|>
It is a form of electromagnetic radiation.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 154, 133, 172]]<|/det|>
<label>C</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 154, 467, 172]]<|/det|>
It is less penetrating than \(\beta\) -radiation.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 181, 133, 199]]<|/det|>
<label>D</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 181, 495, 199]]<|/det|>
It is more highly ionising than \(\alpha\) -radiation.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 227, 104, 245]]<|/det|>
<label>40</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 227, 467, 245]]<|/det|>
A radioactive element undergoes \(\alpha\) -decay.
